column4: livecd has my soundcard working with a module called "snd_ens1370". how do i get that module in my installation? (which package would it be in?)
was it not installed automatically?
i added the card just tonight djdavis75
so you put a different card in the box but it won't work?
yeah, couldn't get the onboard device to work, so stuck a new card in there
and the new card work on the live cd but not on the installed version?
hmm, does it use a restricted driver?
try running the Hardware Drivers app
jamiejackson: hmm, does it use a restricted driver? <= no
the snd-ens1370 modules is on my system
it's not in /lib/modules/whatever/sound/pci ?
i don't have a sound directory in /lib/modules/2.6.28-11-generic
/lib/modules/2.6.28-11-generic/kernel/sound/pci ?
no pci dir in /lib/modules/2.6.28-11-generic/kernel/sound
u probably need to reinstall the kernel modules
which package is that?
some of the sound modules come from linux-image-2.6.28-11-generic but your specific one does show to be owned by any package
I looked in synaptic, that package, linux-image-2.6.28-11-generic contains that module
I would reinstall that package
I wouldn't think so, you should be able to safely reinstall the package
hopefully it will work
that reinstall of the linux image (plus a reboot) seems to have done the trick: i heard the ubuntu greet sound on startup :)
cool
